sentences: Küll see jõmpsikas tahaks ikka tappa!
context: The word 'tapaks' is the partitive singular form of 'tapp' in Estonian. It has two main meanings: 1) referring to killing or slaughter (as in selecting birds for killing), and 2) colloquially meaning a beating or thrashing. The first definition relates to physical termination of life, while the second refers to physical punishment or violence.
